markdown:
Danava titans once regulated the foundational forces that shaped reality. Rebuked by the gods for being harsh and inflexible overseers, these spurned titans joined their siblings in their failed war against their creators. Defeated, the danavas were cast into the paralyzing depths of the cosmos's seas. The few danava titans who have escaped now wield the cold, darkness, and crushing pressure of their prisons in pursuit of their ancient visions of reality. Danavas split mountains, wake primordial beasts, or level whole civilizations in accordance with grand designs they forged at the dawn of time. Others hunt and harvest the balance-enforcing aeons, who they see as usurpers of their divine responsibility. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 51 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 49 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 46 [Danava Titan](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1341) **Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 269 **Perception** +41; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344), [wavesense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=41) (imprecise) 100 feet **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Aquan](/Languages.aspx?ID=14), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) 100 feet **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +39, [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +43, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +46, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +43, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +41, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +43, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +41, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +43 **Str** +11 **Dex** +8 **Con** +10 **Int** +10 **Wis** +8 **Cha** +6 **Items** _+3 [major striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [greatclub](/Weapons.aspx?ID=22)_ --- **AC** 49 **Fort** +41 **Ref** +37 **Will** +37 +4 status to all saves vs. [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106) or [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48) **HP** 470 **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46) **Hadalic Presence** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165)) Creatures that fail their Will save against the titan's Impossible Stature aura also experience the crushing depths and darkness of the ocean floor. Such creatures see as if in an area of [_darkness_](/Spells.aspx?ID=59) (10th level), and the titan can use their wavesense to detect such creatures as a precise sense, even if neither are in water. On a critical failure, the creature is also [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24).
**Impossible Stature** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 100 feet. Titans warp perception and distance around them to seem even larger and more imposing. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the emanation must succeed at a DC 46 Will save or its movement toward the titan is movement over difficult terrain (greater difficult terrain on a critical failure) for 1 round.
**Relentless** The titan is as ever-moving as ocean waves. They're permanently [quickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=32), and the extra action can only be used to Stride, Strike, or Sustain a Spell, or as one of the actions necessary to Cast [_dispel magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=78).
**Roiling Rebuke** **Trigger** A creature within 200 feet targets the titan with or includes the titan in the area of an attack, spell, or other effect; **Effect** The titan makes a benthic wave Strike against the triggering creature. If the Strike hits, the titan disrupts the triggering action. --- **Speed** 50 feet, swim 40 feet; [_air walk_](/Spells.aspx?ID=6), [_water walk_](/Spells.aspx?ID=371) **Melee** _greatclub_ +43 ([Backswing](/Traits.aspx?ID=173), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 40 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Shove](/Traits.aspx?ID=193)), **Damage** 4d10+20 bludgeoning plus 2d12 cold **Melee** foot +40 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d8+20 bludgeoning plus 2d12 cold **Ranged** benthic wave +40 ([Brutal](/Traits.aspx?ID=249), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range 200 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [Water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165)), **Damage** 4d6+20 bludgeoning plus 2d12 cold **Divine Innate Spells** DC 46, attack +38 - **9th** [Control Water](/Spells.aspx?ID=51) (at will), [Dispel Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=78) (at will), [Eclipse Burst](/Spells.aspx?ID=96) (×3), [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148) (×3), [Hydraulic Push](/Spells.aspx?ID=154) (×3), [Hydraulic Torrent](/Spells.aspx?ID=155) (×3) - **10th** [Implosion](/Spells.aspx?ID=162) - **Constant (10th)** [Air Walk](/Spells.aspx?ID=6), [True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344), [Water Walk](/Spells.aspx?ID=371) **Rituals** DC 46, doesn't require secondary casters - **5th** [Resurrect](/Rituals.aspx?ID=20) - **6th** [Planar Binding](/Rituals.aspx?ID=17) - **8th** [Control Weather](/Rituals.aspx?ID=9) **[Trample](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=39)** Huge or smaller, foot, DC 46 **Wide Cleave** The titan makes a melee weapon Strike against each foe within their reach. This counts as three attacks for the titan's multiple attack penalty.
Danava Pillars Some danavas, known as danava pillars, are custodians of a fundamental concept like life or knowledge—a crux of the universe. Destroying a danava pillar forcibly shreds their bonds and risks unraveling a portion of reality, with potentially disastrous effects.
name: Danava Titan
